Fun Fact: Every year, they host the Founder’s Day celebration!
Sisters from the Gamma chapter, along with the Xi chapter, came to Slope Day last year!
The Program Educator of the Charter class was Wendy Chan, an Alpha Delta class sister from Binghamton University!
It is the largest asian-interest sorority on St. John University’s campus.
They are the first Asian interest sorority to be established in New Jersey!
Cornell has the most Instagram followers out of all of the chapters!
Their Spring 2019 rush theme is Winter Wonderland!
Their local philanthropy is YWCA, which works to eliminate racism, empower women, and promote peace.
The Xi chapter won 2018’s National Stroll Competition!
The Omicron chapter has won the “Multicultural Greek Council Chapter of the Year” award 3 years in a row since 2016.
Every year, they host a summit called “Become StrongHer” to empower collegiate women, both in the professional workplace and in everyday life!
Kappa Phi Lambda Sorority Incorporated is the first Asian-interest sorority in the state of Connecticut!
Currently, they are the chapter with the smallest active house, with only 8 active sisters this semester (but that definitely does not mean they aren’t just as amazing as the rest)!
Their online blog is called KUWTK: Keeping Up with the Kappas!
In 2017, their chapter was awarded both Chapter of the Year as well as the Community Service Award by the University of Michigan Multicultural Greek Council.
Their local philanthropy is the National Osteoporosis Foundation!
Their local philanthropy is Courage Connections, which benefits people experiencing homelessness and and domestic violence.
Their charter class consists of only two sisters, and to this day they are the only Asian-interest sorority at George Mason University.
Every year, they have an Annual Philanthropy Benefit Show called Rise that benefits CARE.

Campus: The University of Texas at Austin
Fun Fact: Annually, they create a super cute yearbook to reflect on their achievements and memories from the past year!
They gained chapter status on January 14th, 2018!
Their Spring 2013 rush theme was Dr. Seuss!
15 out of 22 of their active sisters are juniors!
They are Kappa Phi Lambda Sorority Incorporated’s newest established location, as they were rechartered just this last November.
They are the only Asian-interest sorority in Denver!

Campus: University of North Carolina - Chapel Hill
Fun Fact: Their charters started as an interest group by the name of A.R.I.E.S - Aspiring to Raise Interest in Excellence and Service.
For two years in a row, their colony won the University of Nevada Reno’s Overall Chapter of the Year award!

V.E.N.U.S. Interest Group (Virtue, Ethics, Nobleness, Unity, and Serenity), was formed in the summer of 2012 in the hope to bring Kappa Phi Lambda Sorority, Inc. onto the University of South Florida’s campus.

Campus: University of North Carolina at Charlotte
Fun Fact: They were initially created as the interest group called PULSE in 2016.
They currently only have 3 active sisters, all of whom are part of their charter class!
